channel.title: Your thoughts
channel.description:
So I'm a senior in high school, and I've been doing online school.
Anyways to the point: I've been falling behind because the work is so much, I wake up at 6 AM and work until 5-6 PM with occasional 30 minute breaks.
I have no idea how I'm so far behind as I actually do my schoolwork, but the semester is coming to an end and I'm behind in 3 classes.
What are some tips?
Inb4trollz.
If you troll just get the fuck out.

item.title: Your thoughts
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:24, topic:427876”]Relax. It may seem paradoxical that the first step to better concentration refers to relaxation, but there are many intense intellects who fail in their concentration because they never relax. Failure to let go between efforts is their chief stumbling block. They keep them-selves tense, nervous, “keyed-up” all the time, even when there is no need for it, thereby wasting nervous energy. They find it very difficult to “let go” or to relieve the high-tension by a little natural, wholesome relaxation. But we must learn to let go, to relax completely, before each period of intense concentration. Here is the working principle: Relaxation precedes perfect concentration. All great mental achievement has been preceded by periods of absolute rest or relaxation! During this time, the mind stores up fresh energy and establishes a reserve to draw upon during the hours of intense concentration demanded by the big task that lies ahead. Different people take their relaxation best in different ways, but, whether in complete rest, of play or wholesome laughter, it must come before any sustained effort of concentration. Nature itself requires cycles of growth and rest. Take your breathing spell before the battle.2

Free the mind. Free the mind. Nothing is of greater aid to concentration. In fact, unless you are able to do this, concentration is impossible. When harassed by the three devils, hurry, worry, and fear, the mind never has a fair chance to center on anything. But in your period of relaxation, you have an excellent opportunity to free the mind. Now is your chance to eliminate all mental handicaps and get ready for the race. Not only hurry, worry, and fear must be thrown overboard, but anything and everything that troubles you and disturbs your serenity and your peace of mind. Out they go! You should not indulge in day-dreaming, either, or mental drifting. Practice meditation. Clear the mental horizon; give yourself a clean slate to write on when your hour of concentration comes. And when it comes, if you have relaxed and cleared your mind, you will be possessed of that rare thing: mental poise.
3Find the right conditions. It’s true that a trained mind can concentrate under any conditions—-in the roar of crowded cities or the busy hum of traffic, in the midst of telephone calls or a thousand and one other interruptions. But these people are already masters of concentration, and this article is addressing those who have not yet learned how to concentrate. Therefore, it’s only a matter of common sense to make conditions as favorable as possible. Some of our greatest creative thinkers absolutely insist on right conditions and the right kind of a place in which to produce their masterpieces. True, good books have been written in mail, great poems written in the trenches, masterly speeches conceived on an express train. But in every case there was a degree of concentration strong enough to rise triumphant above the environment. Otherwise, keep the following conditions in mind:

Seek a quiet place free from all distractions (and noise is a terrible distractor), a place free from all interruptions which may break your train of thought (and a telephone is a terrible interrupter), a place where you can be alone, free from all outside influences (and a friend who “must drop in” is a terrible outside influence), and a place of pleasing environment, beautiful or otherwise, where the atmosphere is right for you. Seek a quiet place free from all distractions (and noise is a terrible distractor), a place free from all interruptions which may break your train of thought (and a telephone is a terrible interrupter), a place where you can be alone, free from all outside influences (and a friend who “must drop in” is a terrible outside influence), and a place of pleasing environment, beautiful or otherwise, where the atmosphere is right for you. Preferences differ with the individual; it’s all in the mind. One may do his or her best work seated in a luxurious chair in a beautiful and artistic study–another may reach his or her highest plane of creative thinking while sitting under a lone pine tree on the crest of a hill. Choose your own place for concentration. Use ear plugs, occupational ear defenders or even both!

Solitude has always been, in all the history of mental achievement, a requisite for great work. Solitude has always been, in all the history of mental achievement, a requisite for great work. Solitude calls forth the mood of receptivity. Only then do we get the best. Great things are worked out in silence. Then come the flashes of inspiration—the new visions. History reflects the statement that to bear solitude well is a mark of greatness. And today, right in this practical present, thousands of our most successful business men have learned this secret…That by getting alone, they can gain new efficiency, and think out better plans for managing their daily affairs.
4

Make a daily schedule.Make a daily schedule. Your daily schedule helps to focus the mind, holding it steadily to one thing at a time and in the right order. Following a logical sequence tends to eliminate confusion. It’s been demonstrated in efficiency tests over and over again that time and energy are lost not so much on the operation itself as in passing from one operation to another. So in our mental operations, failure to move smoothly from one thing to another results in confusion. And when confusion comes, concentration goes. A definite daily schedule is a wonderful aid in keeping the mind on the right track. It often proves to be the salvation of those who have been unable to concentrate. Try it.

huge LIST of Ways to concentrate
SRC: Google[/quote]
greatly appreciated, couldn’t find one like this, I’ve tried most of those techniques but thanks!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

Failure to let go between efforts is their chief stumbling block. They keep them-selves tense, nervous, “keyed-up” all the time, even when there is no need for it, thereby wasting nervous energy. All great mental achievement has been preceded by periods of absolute rest or relaxation! During this time, the mind stores up fresh energy and establishes a reserve to draw upon during the hours of intense concentration demanded by the big task that lies ahead. It’s true that a trained mind can concentrate under any conditions—-in the roar of crowded cities or the busy hum of traffic, in the midst of telephone calls or a thousand and one other interruptions. Therefore, it’s only a matter of common sense to make conditions as favorable as possible. Some of our greatest creative thinkers absolutely insist on right conditions and the right kind of a place in which to produce their masterpieces. Seek a quiet place free from all distractions (and noise is a terrible distractor), a place free from all interruptions which may break your train of thought (and a telephone is a terrible interrupter), a place where you can be alone, free from all outside influences (and a friend who “must drop in” is a terrible outside influence), and a place of pleasing environment, beautiful or otherwise, where the atmosphere is right for you. Choose your own place for concentration. Use ear plugs, occupational ear defenders or even both!

Solitude has always been, in all the history of mental achievement, a requisite for great work. Solitude has always been, in all the history of mental achievement, a requisite for great work. Solitude calls forth the mood of receptivity. Only then do we get the best. Great things are worked out in silence. Then come the flashes of inspiration—the new visions. History reflects the statement that to bear solitude well is a mark of greatness. And today, right in this practical present, thousands of our most successful business men have learned this secret…That by getting alone, they can gain new efficiency, and think out better plans for managing their daily affairs.
4

Make a daily schedule.Make a daily schedule. Your daily schedule helps to focus the mind, holding it steadily to one thing at a time and in the right order. Following a logical sequence tends to eliminate confusion. It’s been demonstrated in efficiency tests over and over again that time and energy are lost not so much on the operation itself as in passing from one operation to another. So in our mental operations, failure to move smoothly from one thing to another results in confusion. And when confusion comes, concentration goes. A definite daily schedule is a wonderful aid in keeping the mind on the right track. It often proves to be the salvation of those who have been unable to concentrate. Try it.

huge LIST of Ways to concentrate
SRC: Google

no derr

Yeah haha. I get side tracked easily.
[/quote]set aside so many minutes in the morning then so many minutes before bed for the work.

Yeah i worked out a schedule last night

I did all online highschool last year, and it literally took less than an hour a day to keep up… I find it hard to believe they’d make it that difficult :\

We’ll this program comes from a really good high school, and their known for their difficulty, It looks really good on a college resume(reh-zoo-mey)

I did an online course at my old school and it took around 15 minutes everyday (just one course) but this is freaking hard

Then admit you won’t amount to anything, since you can’t even complete highschool online[/quote]
Wow dick head, burn in hell, I said no fucking trolling, If i wanted to give up on life I would have by now, assholes like you just need to kill yourself so you can’t reproduce making more. Senioritus dumb shit, I feel un-encouraged and it feels like its way to much dick head.

Inb4warning

item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

Wet Dreamss:

I’m asking for advice, and I don’t need studying right now, I needed to figure out some techniques to get a lot of school work done and keep interested it it :3

DO you need any tips about concentrating or anything like that?

Read full topic

item.title: Your thoughts
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Get a whip board and write down your goals for the day. Make a time table that allows you to finish your school work in time, doing 2-3 assignments in each class per day.

Read full topic

Inb4trollz.

make a schedule, manage your time. give space to your thoughts
if you can’t keep up, quit. Unless you are one of those kids that are feeding the whole family.
